summary: This document appears to be a transcript of grand jury testimony or an investigative interview regarding the events surrounding Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in August 2019. The testimony focuses on prison staff roles, count procedures, and potential errors in inmate tracking and documentation on the night Epstein died.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inmate whose death is being investigated. He was moved to a R&D holding cell but not properly removed from the SHU count.

persons.name: Marugo
persons.context: Identified as the Control Two officer on August 9th, who should have keyed Epstein out of the SHU and into R&D.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell. Officers responded to an alarm at 6:33 am, assisted, and followed the ambulance to the hospital.

events.title: Incorrect Cell Count Procedures
events.description: Epstein was moved to a R&D holding cell at 3:15 pm but was never removed from the SHU count. Subsequent 4 pm, 10 pm, and 12 am count slips from the SHU were inaccurate.

events.title: Staff Shift and Count Responsibilities
events.description: The testifying officer was Control One from 4 pm to midnight on Aug 9, and Internal Two from midnight to 8 am on Aug 10. Internal Two left at 10 pm instead of 12 am, altering count procedures.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) - implied location of events
keyFacts: The testifying officer admitted to 'dropping the ball' regarding the inaccurate count slips and failure to generate a new Electronic Entry (El) when discrepancies were known.
Epstein was moved to an R&D holding cell at 3:15 pm on August 9, 2019, but the SHU never removed him from their inmate count, causing all subsequent SHU counts (4 pm, 10 pm, 12 am) to be inaccurate.
A procedural change to save money had Internal Two officers leaving at 10 pm instead of midnight, which affected who was responsible for counts.
Handwriting analysis on count slips is a focus, with the officer confirming some markings as his but expressing uncertainty about others, particularly a '+1' on a SHU slip.
Control personnel may not have been notified of Epstein's move, so they did not make the necessary key entries to transfer him from the SHU to R&D in the system.
